vision.notes: Accipitridae are birds of prey, relying heavily on vision for hunting. They have strongly hooked bills and variable morphology based on diet. Many well-known birds such as hawks, eagles, kites, harriers and Old World vultures are included in this group.

olfaction.notes: Most Accipitridae do not have a strong sense of smell, unlike New World vultures. The lappet-faced vulture (Torgos tracheliotos) does not share the good sense of smell of some members of that family of birds.

hearing.notes: Hearing is likely important for prey detection, though specifics are not detailed in the provided context.

electroreception.notes: Electroreception capabilities are not mentioned in the context.

magnetoreception.notes: Magnetoreception capabilities are not mentioned in the context, although some species are migratory.
